Posts.Content: Hi I had oncotype test with a score of 20, my oncologist said I wouldn't benefit from chemo.   Hr+ with 70mm grade 2 lobular cancer.  Had mx in July after unsuccessful wle and 15 sessions of radio (last one tomorrow) Hope your treatment goes well X
Posts.Title: Oncotype dx

Posts.Content: I had a mastectomy (July 2016) followed by radiotherapy.  My surgeon wouldn't do immediate recon because he said I would need the radiotherapy.  I'm off to see him on Friday to discuss my options, but to be quite honest I'm happy living lopsided (my foob only comes out on special occasions).
Posts.Title: Immediate reconstruction or staged?

Posts.Content: Can't agree more, I've found m&s selection depressing as you say hundreds of underwired in all colours, shapes and sizes and a few post surgery shoved in the corner.  They say they support breast cancer but seem ashamed to display it.  My other gripe is that post surgery underwear is vat free yet similar no wired styles seem to always be a couple of £ cheaper, how does that work!? Hope you find something x
Posts.Title: Bras - rant!!!!

Posts.Content: I went to Lanzarote at Christmas and am going to Majorca on Monday, never ever occurred to me that I should stop tamoxifen, oops Have a good time x
Posts.Title: Flying while on tamoxifen

Posts.Content: Hi all Just thought I would update you re my experience of R1&R2.  After several conversations with different gp's at my practice it was eventually prescribed, not without me becoming very tearful I will admit and I still think the doctor was unhappy to let me have it. Yesterday i finished my 15 sessions, post mx with a jelly pad, and apart from a slight pink rectangle my skin has held up really well, in fact the radiographer was surprised it was so good! I have no idea if it would have been the same with E45 (that's what my gp wanted me to use) but I'm glad i had a breakdown and got it.  I've used more of the R2 and will continue to until it runs out!  I found R1  a bit messy, especially if I wasn't able to go straight home to put it on, think most of it was absorbed into my clothes. Now feeling a little 'lost', no hospital today! I've just phoned my BC nurse to ask what happens next, I've an oncology appointment in November and a Breast Unit appointment next February but I want to talk about reconstruction (not sure I want it but want to talk about it) and a prosthesis I hate the softie and am using a knitted knocker if I feel the need to be even. Sorry I'm rambling now, have a good day everyone x
Posts.Title: R1 R2 Update after radiotherapy

Posts.Content: A difficult one, my oncotype was 20 and my onc said no need for chemo so I didn't have to make the decision myself. Not sure that helps but good luck with whatever you decide x
Posts.Title: Help Oncotype result!! Advice please x

Posts.Content: I don't know the answer but I have an appointments with the plastic surgeon to discuss this in a few weeks.  My breast surgeon recommended this type or recon and I have had 2 c-sections (16 years ago) and I'm sure that's on my notes.  I hadn't even considered it being a problem. I've got plenty of stomach fat, lol Welshie007 Due to have mastectomy - anyone have experience of having a DIEP reconstruction when previously had C-Section.  My daughter is 13 now so not a new section by any means.  Also, were there issues if your BMI was over 25 i.e. overweight?
Posts.Title: DIEP after C-Sections

Posts.Content: I've just bought soft front fastening bras from Amazon, they were about £8.  They are not cup sized so they stretch to fit, I'm finding them perfect for my left sided mastectomy.  I'm usually a 38d and one side stays flat and the other stretches to fit, not sure I'm explaining that very well but hopefully you get the gist!  I don't like the softie so I'm happy with this until my radio is finished. Hope you find something
Posts.Title: Post-mastectomy bra

Posts.Content: I wrote letters to the friends I wanted to know from me and not anyone else and delivered them on the same day so they all knew at the same time.  I personally have never written it as a Facebook status and I’m sure some of my ‘Facebook’ friends still don’t know.  I’m not a particularly private person but I just felt that some things are best kept off social media. X
Posts.Title: How to tell friends?

Posts.Content: Hi I'm going through radiotherapy at the moment, I'm wearing front fastening bras from Amazon, they are about £8 each. 90% cotton 10% elastase.  Not very attractive but do the job.  They are not cup sized so stretch to fit.  I'm finding them great for a mastectomy, the one side stays flat and the other stretches to a c/d cup. I've also got r1 &r2 creams from gp for skin care, after a bit of a issue getting them prescribed. Good luck with your treatment x
Posts.Title: Bra for radiotherapy

Posts.Content: I just bought a pillow from Wowcher, it was about £6 and I have to say it's brilliant!
Posts.Title: Tamoxifen and night sweats

Posts.Content: Hi It's an interesting journey isn't it, my last radiotherapy is next Wednesday, a week today you're!  But that means I am meant to go back to 'normal' and work!? I can't believe I've been away for  so long and that I haven't missed it at all.  I was diagnosed in May and had my first surgery mid June, followed by mx on 5th July (date imprinted in my mind) just 5 days before my 51st birthday. Taking time out has made me realise that's there's more to life than work and it's also been an interesting journey with friends and relatives, but that's another story.  I'm not sure what happens next, it will be strange not having a diary full of appointments to work round.   Glad you've reached the end  X
Posts.Title: Who am I now? Answers on a postcard please.....

Posts.Content: Whoops .... I thought that said a week today yipee!
Posts.Title: Who am I now? Answers on a postcard please.....

Posts.Content: My oncotype took about 2 weeks to come back, I was scored at 20 and chemo wasn't recommended.  I would ring them in a couple of weeks and see if they have the results.  X
Posts.Title: Will oncotype dx results be different?

Posts.Content: Hi Search for front fastening on Amazon, I've bought a couple and would recommend they are about £7.50/£8ish and made from cotton.  Not cup sized but I have found them fine for my one 38d sized boob! Hope everything goes well x
Posts.Title: Bra advice after surgery

Posts.Content: Hi it's daft question afternoon, I was diagnosed with lobular cancer last year had wle followed by mastectomy and radiotherapy, now I know everyone is different but by a cruel twist of fate a close friend was diagnosed with lobular cancer just before Christmas, she's gone down the mastectomy with immediate recon route (I wasn't offered immediate recon as I needed rt) but now for my question she has been sent for a dexa scan and been told it's because her type of cancer is 'very hormone sensitive' but aren't they the same? Should I be concerned I've not had a dexa scan?  We are being treated by the same surgeon at the same hospital. Thanks
Posts.Title: Bone density scan, should I have had one?

Posts.Content: Dreamthief Hi tarneh  The only daft question is the one that isn't asked  Noticed you are taking Tamoxifen - Your friend must be post menopause and is taking either Letrozole, Anastrozole or Exemstane as her ovaries won't be producing the oestrogen? Those types of tablet can cause bone thinning which can lead to osteopaenia and a Dexa scan checks bone density to keep an eye on this. They perform the first scan before starting the tablets to get base line figures, then again after 6 months or so to see if they are causing any bone density change. You don't get this problem with Tamoxifen so unless they change you to those mentioned above in a couple of years (which they sometimes do) it isn't a concern Hope this help, G n' J Thanks that's the strange thing, she's def not post menopause as until diagnosis she was still taking contraceptive pill and as yet she hasn't been pescribed hormone tablets.  I on the other hand have been told I am almost certainly post menopause, I had a blood test last year as I want to get rid of my coil, but the gp was against it but that's another story.
Posts.Title: Bone density scan, should I have had one?
